definitions.definition: that is a basic or permanent part of somebody/something and that cannot be removed

examples.text: the difficulties inherent in a study of this type
Violence is inherent in our society.
an inherent weakness in the design of the machine

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from Latin inhaerent- ‘sticking to’, from the verb inhaerere, from in- ‘in, towards’ + haerere ‘to stick’.
